item.description:
Report X-2024110518

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUGHT THEIR TRAM OVER AND INDICATED TO SOME HAZMATS WITH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS AND SAID HE COULD SMELL A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR COMING FROM ONE OF THE PACKAGES. RESPONDER FOUND A PACKAGE WITH 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND FOUND 1 CONTAINER HAD LEAKED SOME LIQUID FROM ITS CAP, STAINING/WETTING THE INTERNAL CARDBOARD.

item.title: Report E-2024110224
item.description:
Report E-2024110224

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-21
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately four (4) gallons of product released from four (4) one (1) gallon jerricans impacting the dock floor. Personnel advised the release was due to shifting while in transit. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned release using floor dri absorbent, the team confirmed they generated one (1) 95-gallon poly drum of waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110193
item.description:
Report E-2024110193

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: WAITE PARK
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XBD experienced a UN3352 Lambda-Cyhalothrin 1 EC release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor. The box was damaged due to improper loading, appearing to have been hit by another pallet or forklift. A total of (8) 1-gallon poly jugs of product were found impacted and placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents, cardboard, PPE, and cleanup debris were placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
